trans-unit.source: Provides a parent class for all three-dimensional transformations, including translation, rotation, and scale transformations.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MatrixTransform3D> class to create transformations not available from the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.RotateTransform3D>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.TranslateTransform3D>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ScaleTransform3D> classes.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Transform3D"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Transform3D"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `true`.
Gets the identity transformation.
The identity transformation has the effect of multiplying the object by the identity matrix.
Identity transformation.
Gets the inverse transformation of this object, if possible.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Transform3D.Inverse%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
An inverse of this instance, if possible; otherwise, `null`.
Gets a value that specifies whether the matrix is affine.
An affine transformation preserves collinearity.
`true` if the matrix is affine; otherwise, `false`.
Transforms the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref>.
Point3D to transform.
Transformed Point3D.
Transforms the specified array of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> objects.
Array of Point3D objects to transform.
Transforms the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref>.
Point4D to transform.
Transformed Point4D.
Transforms the specified array of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D"></xref> objects.
Array of Point4D objects to transform.
Transforms the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref>.
Vector3D to transform.
Transformed Vector3D.
Transforms the specified array of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> objects.
Array of Vector3D objects to transform.
Transforms the specified 3-D bounding box and returns an axis-aligned 3-D bounding box that is exactly large enough to contain it.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Transform3D.TransformBounds%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The 3-D bounding box to transform.
The smallest axis-aligned 3-D bounding box possible that contains the transformed rect.
Attempts to transform the specified 3-D point and returns a value that indicates whether the transformation was successful.
Unlike the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3D.Transform%2A> method, this method does not throw an exception if the transformation is unsuccessful.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Transform3D.TryTransform%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The 3-D point to transform.
The result of transforming inPoint.
`true` if inPoint was transformed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> that represents the value of the current transformation.
Matrix3D that represents the value of the current transformation.
